importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Kada Scott was last seen at her workplace on this date, marking the beginning of the investigation into her disappearance.
Two weeks after her disappearance, human remains were found in a shallow grave, leading to the possibility of her death and the ongoing investigation.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time between Kada Scott's last known contact and her disappearance is critical, as it marks the window during which her disappearance began and during which tracking of her phone and interactions with suspect Keon King began.

keyTakeAways: A 23-year-old Philadelphia woman, Kada Scott, went missing on October 4, 2025, after being last seen at her workplace.
Two weeks later, human remains of an unidentified female were found in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in a wooded area.
Police believe the remains may belong to Kada Scott, pending confirmation by the medical examiner.
Keon King, a 21-year-old man, was arrested and charged with Scott’s kidnapping, as well as a prior kidnapping involving a woman he previously knew, indicating a potential pattern of behavior.
King’s phone was used to track communications with Scott, making him the last known person in contact with her before she went offline.
An anonymous tip led investigators to the shallow grave and also to a gold 1999 Toyota Camry, which is believed to be linked to King and possibly to Scott’s disappearance.
The case involves both a kidnapping and a possible pattern of criminal behavior, with prior charges against King withdrawn in May 2025 but refiled due to new investigation and evidence.
Video and digital evidence show Scott and King had contact shortly after she left her workplace, and she disconnected from all communication channels.
Police are investigating whether other individuals were involved, but all leads currently point to King as central to the case.
The Philadelphia Police Department, with FBI assistance, is leading the investigation, emphasizing the urgency and complexity of finding answers for Scott’s family.

namedEntities.name: Kada Scott
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 23-year-old woman from Philadelphia who went missing on October 4, 2025, and whose remains were later found in a shallow grave.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Kada Scott is the central figure in a high-profile missing persons case that has drawn national attention, with her disappearance and subsequent discovery of human remains raising questions about foul play, kidnapping, and public safety.

namedEntities.name: Keon King
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 21-year-old suspect arrested and charged with the kidnapping of Kada Scott and a prior case involving a domestic kidnapping and assault.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Keon King is a key suspect due to being the last person in contact with Kada Scott and having a prior criminal record involving kidnapping and assault, suggesting a possible pattern of criminal behavior.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Police Department
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The local law enforcement agency leading the investigation into Kada Scott’s disappearance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Philadelphia Police Department is central to the investigation, working with FBI task forces to track evidence, follow leads, and manage the search for Kada Scott and the discovery of her remains.

namedEntities.name: FBI Violent Crime Task Force
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A federal investigative unit providing support to local police in the investigation.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The involvement of the FBI adds federal attention and resources to the case, indicating the severity and potential national significance of the incident.

namedEntities.name: Medical Examiner’s Office
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The agency responsible for determining whether the found remains belong to Kada Scott.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The medical examiner’s office plays a critical role in confirming the identity of the remains, which is essential for determining whether Kada Scott is deceased and whether the case has a resolution.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Mayor Cherelle Parker
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The city's official who has publicly expressed support for Kada Scott’s family.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The mayor’s statement shows the broader civic and emotional impact of the case, reflecting public concern and institutional support for the family’s grief and search for truth.

namedEntities.name: Kim Matthews
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Mother of Kada Scott, who expressed fear and anguish about her daughter’s disappearance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Kim Matthews represents the emotional core of the case, highlighting the personal impact and desperation of a family seeking answers and safety for their missing loved one.

namedEntities.name: Kevin Scott
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Father of Kada Scott, who urged the public to come forward with information.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Kevin Scott’s statements emphasize public engagement and the importance of small clues in solving the mystery of his daughter’s disappearance.

namedEntities.name: Gold 1999 Toyota Camry
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A vehicle believed to be linked to Keon King and possibly to Kada Scott’s disappearance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The vehicle is a key piece of physical evidence, tied to digital tracking and a tip that led investigators to a crucial location, making it central to the current investigation.

namedEntities.name: Assistant District Attorney Ashley Toczylowski
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Prosecutor leading the district attorney’s office in the investigation.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She provided key statements about the suspect, the timeline, and the connection between the two kidnapping cases, making her a central figure in legal developments.

namedEntities.name: First Deputy Commissioner John Stanford
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Philadelphia Police official who announced the discovery of remains and addressed the investigation’s progress.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He provided official updates on the case, including the discovery of remains and the role of public tips, establishing credibility and transparency in the investigation.

namedEntities.name: Frank Vanore
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Philadelphia Police Deputy Commissioner who discussed the pattern of behavior and the role of phone tracking.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Vanore emphasized the suspected pattern of criminal behavior and the importance of tracking communications to locate the missing person.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A 23-year-old Philadelphia woman, Kada Scott, went missing on October 4, 2025, after being last seen at her workplace. Two weeks later, human remains of an unidentified female were found in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school. Police believe the remains may belong to Scott, and suspect Keon King, a 21-year-old man, is central to the case due to being the last person in contact with her and having prior charges involving a similar kidnapping. Tracking of King’s phone and digital communications led investigators to him, and a key anonymous tip helped locate both the grave and a gold 1999 Toyota Camry linked to King. The case is being investigated by the Philadelphia Police Department with FBI assistance, and authorities are exploring whether this is part of a broader pattern of criminal behavior. The family, including Scott’s parents, continues to plead for public assistance and closure.
title: Police Investigating Disappearance of Philadelphia Woman Say Tip Led to Shallow Grave with Human Remains
